cab.content: g DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY5 S GOVERN ME NT. ) CABINET. COMMITTEE ON IMPERIAL PREFERENCE FOR PALESTINE. REPORT. At their Meeting on 11 th October, 19 52 (Cabinet 50 (32)Conclusion 8) the Cabinet had before them a Memorandum bythe Secretary of State for the Colonies (CP. 333 (32))on the subject of Imperial Preference for Palestine, and approved the proposal to refer the question to the CabinetCommittee appointed at the Meeting on February 17th, 1932(Cabinet 14 (32)), to which the Attorney-General shouldbe added. The Committee have had before them the Memorandum(Paper CP. 363(32)) circulated to the Cabinet by the ForeignOffice. In view of the considerations set out in that memorandum the Committee have reluctantly reached the conclusionthat the proposal to extend Imperial Preference to Palestinemust be abandoned. At the same time the Committee hopethat in any subsequent negotiations for commercial treaties with foreign countries efforts will be made to secure somepreference for the products of Palestine./IRET.. 357 (52).COPYSigned on behalf of the CoEmltteeP. CUNLIFFE-LISTER.CHAIRMAN.Colonial Office, 28th October, 1932.
